subject: p19182863
Findings: Left PICC enters a left-sided superior vena cava and subsequently courses vertically to terminate in the lower left hemithorax, just above the level of the diaphragm. Withdrawal by approximately 8 cm could be performed to ensure positioning within the lower left superior vena cava. Cardiac silhouette remains enlarged. Opacities involving the right middle and right lower lobe appear slightly improved and may reflect atelectasis and/or infectious consolidation. Moderate right pleural effusion with subpulmonic and intrafissural components is unchanged as well as a small left pleural effusion.
